subject: RE: [junit] NEW Object instance
msgSnippet: Jason, Something like: public void testRemoval() { ProprietaryList list = new ProprietaryList(); Object instance = new Object(); list.add(instance);
messageBody:
Jason,



Something like:



public void testRemoval() {
ProprietaryList list = new ProprietaryList();
Object instance = new Object();
list.add(instance);
list.remove(instance);
assertFalse(list.contains(instance));
}



Or



public void testRemoval() {
ProprietaryList list = new ProprietaryList();
Object instance = new Object();
list.add(instance);

list.remove(instance);

assertFalse(list.contains(instance));
}

Thanks,

-Kamal.



_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
jason r tibbetts
Sent: Friday, May 05, 2006 10:26 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] NEW Object instance



Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> Hi,
>
> How can we verify, using JUnit if an object is really created, if a "new"
> operator is used to instantiate an object.

As opposed to what? malloc()? ;)
